results.title: Five towns
results.creator_credit: Green Park Productions and Terry Bishop
results.brief_description: The pottery industry seen though the eyes of a young London girl marrying into a typical potteries family. The film tells of the life of the people in the potteries and of the great industry in which they work. It shows ways in which conditions of work are in process of being modernised. Factory sequences were shot at the Crown Staffordshire Pottery, Fenton and the Wedgwood Pottery.

results.title: Five times dizzy. - Episodes 7-12.
results.creator_credit: Tom Jeffrey, Samson Film Services, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, Australian Children's Television Foundation and John Eastway
results.brief_description: The final three episodes in the dramatisation of Nadia Wheatley’s award winning book about a family of Greek immigrants in Sydney’s Newtown, their homesick grandmother and the inhabitants of the street in which they live, as seen through the eyes of Mareka, the young daughter.

results.title: Five times dizzy. - Episodes 1-6.
results.creator_credit: Tom Jeffrey, Samson Film Services, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, Australian Children's Television Foundation and John Eastway
results.brief_description: The first three episodes in a dramatisation of Nadia Wheatley’s award winning book. Mareka would be quite happy in the milk bar in Newtown, even though it is so far from Greece, if it wasn’t for the Wilson kids giving her a hard time. But her Yaya, her grandmother, has only recently arrived in Australia and feels lost and unhappy. If only Mareka could find her Yaya something to do. Then she has an idea. But it’s such a big idea she feels dizzy.

results.title: Five steps to conflict resolution (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dave Bell Associates, Dave Bell and Bruce Johnson
results.brief_description: Dr. William Glasser presents five steps to help teachers and administrators deal with personal, classroom, school-wide and community related conflict. When conflicts arise it is desirable to have an approach that will turn it in to a positive experience.

results.title: Five steps to better farm living
results.brief_description: Agricultural economist R.R. Hare discusses the importance of a good farm management. Profitable farming depends upon effective land use, good livestock management, effective use of labor, efficient use of capital and optimum business size. Victory Bonds are recommended as a way of saving money to make farm improvements following the end of World War II.

results.title: Five sides of a coin = 5 sides of a coin
results.creator_credit: 7th Art Releasing, Anomaly Collective, Canada Council for the Arts, Paul Kell and Jana Ritter
results.brief_description: An informative documentary on the rise of the five elements of the Hip Hop movement - Emcee’ing, DeeJay’ing, Breakin,’ Graffiti Writing and Beatboxing. An overview for the novice or an exciting compilation for the fan, this films serves to broaden the knowledge base of the viewer by providing an understanding of the complexity of the worldwide Hip Hop genre of music. Hip Hop is more than just the commercial hits on MTV: the complex rhyming of MCs, the skill of the turntable DJs, the fancy moves of the Break Dancers, the artistry of Graffiti and the wonder of the human voice in reproducing sounds through Beatboxing are all shown and discussed by those passionate about the culture. Some of the artists featured include: Common, DeLaSoul, Grandmaster Flash, DJ Jazzy Jay, Mercedies Ladies, Prince Paul and many others. Animation by Skilla, original music by Manifest, Son of Mac, Zinndeadly, Big Dro, DJ Emergency.

results.title: Five short films by Clayton Jacobson
results.creator_credit: Five Easy Pieces, Ghost Pictures, Bison Films and Clayton Jacobson
results.brief_description: Clayton Jacobson graduated from Swinburne Film and Television School in 1984 and has subsequently directed numerous music videos, television advertisements and award-winning short films. ‘Environmental’: A man is threatened by a masked bandit who breaks into his home. But instead of cleaning the house out, this thief cleans it up! A story about environmental awareness, an obsessively green bandit and a man’s conversion from litter dropper to neat freak. ‘The Pin Drop’: A film without words, this darkly gruesome bloody tale of murder is beautifully filmed in atmospheric black and white. ‘Tickler’: A couple debate the size, shape and purchase of a vibrator as they sit in a car outside a sex shop in this funny engaging film. ‘Tanaka’ When a young Japanese man is sent by his family to Australia to oversee his uncle’s funeral, he is thrust into a world of cross-cultural love, grief and misunderstanding. ‘I Love U’: The silent world of deaf lovers is shattered by obsession, denial and a recurring dream of betrayal. Cast: Kym Gygnell, Rhys Muldoon (Environmental)—Ronald Jacobson, Raylene Gordon (The Pin Drop)—Clayton Jacobson, Chris Bartlett (Tickler)—Morihiko Hasebe, Ronald Jacobson, Chris Bartlett, Ant Keogh (Tanaka)—Fiona Crisp, Ross Onley-Zerkel, Richard Neville (I Love U). ‘Tanaka’ is also available separately on VHS.

results.title: Five run away together. Five have a wonderful time
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous Five”.
In “Five run away together”, the children run away from Kirrin Cottage, when the bad Mrs. Stick, who is looking after them for a week, threatens to lock Timmy in the shed. They escape to Kirrin Island, where all is not as it should be. “Five have a wonderful time” introduces us to a snake-charmer called Miss Slither, and a fire-eater called Alfredo. While on their caravanning holiday, the children find that they must enlist the help of these new friends when they uncover a mystery at nearby Faynight’s Castle.

results.title: Five revolutionary painters: Van Gogh
results.brief_description: A review of this great painter’s life illustrated by his paintings, drawings and etchings. Through art he sought to perceive life. Caring little for society he depicted peasant life boldly. His feeling for detail is shown in the “Potato Eaters” and “At the gate of Eternity”. His self-portraits show him to be a nervous obstinate visionary. He used bright colors to show character. A wonderful understanding of drawing is shown in the picture of the Red boats in the South of France, where the brilliant light inspired him to paint. Narrated by Sir Kenneth Clark.

results.title: Five revolutionary painters: Rembrandt
results.brief_description: This film is about 17th Century Dutch painter Rembrandt. The son of a prosperous miller, Rembrandt was influenced by Caravaggio. This film is mainly about his etchings, most of which were done between 1639 and 1661. In particular we see his illustrations inspired by subjects in the Old and New Testaments. Illustrated by copies collected from Paris, Turin, Munich, Berlin and the Hague. Narrated by Sir Kenneth Clark.
